related_facts.fact_group_content: Germany saw the emergence of 245 AI startups.
The German private sector has created over 100 AI related start-ups since 2015.
72% in Germany believe AI will be the dominant technology of the next decade.
67% of respondents worldwide believe AI will be the dominant technology.
Two years ago, the proportion in Germany was 42%.
AI could add an additional EUR 116 billion to the German economy by 2030.
68 percent of German companies could improve their turnover by introducing AI technology.
34% of respondents in Germany believe AI will have a positive impact on society.
66% of respondents in China expect AI to have a positive impact.
The German government has pledged €3bn for AI development until 2025.
Germany is looking to establish 12 research centres for AI R&D.

clusters.title: German AI
clusters.description: Germany has seen the rise of 245 AI startups, with the private sector contributing over 100 since 2015. AI is expected to add EUR 116 billion to the German economy by 2030. A majority of Germans (72%) see it as the dominant future technology, up from 42% two years ago, and the government is investing €3 billion in AI development. Germany plans to set up 12 AI research centres to bolster R&D efforts.

merged_facts.merged_content: According to a study by Amazon Web Services (AWS) and Strand Partners published in June 2024, 68% of German companies could improve their turnover by introducing AI technology. Meanwhile, 72% of Germans believe AI will be the dominant technology of the next decade. Two years ago, 42% of Germans held this belief. Additionally, the Bosch Tech Compass survey conducted in fall 2024 found that 67% of respondents worldwide believe AI will be the dominant technology.

merged_facts.narrative: A recent study by AWS and Strand Partners reveals that 68% of German companies see potential turnover improvements with AI adoption. Interest in AI is growing, with 72% of Germans now believing it will dominate the next decade—a significant rise from 42% two years ago. Global sentiment echoes this, as 67% of worldwide respondents also view AI as the future, according to the Bosch Tech Compass survey.

According to the Bosch Tech Compass survey conducted in fall 2024, 66% of respondents in China expect AI to have a positive impact.

related_facts.fact_group_content: The UK is home to 334 AI startups.
Germany leads with 167 AI startups.
France has 135 AI startups.
The UK’s number of companies engaged in AI has grown by 145% in the past ten years.
London has over 760 AI enterprises, with around 650 in London.
43% of London AI start-ups have been founded by non-UK nationals.
London received over £200m in private funding and £500m in public funding for AI in 2017.
The British government has invested £100 million in a supercomputer facility in Bristol.
The UK’s AI market is currently valued at over $21 billion.
£300 million of the AI deal is public funding.

clusters.title: UK AI
clusters.description: The UK is a leading hub for AI startups, hosting 334 companies, surpassing Germany's 167 and France's 135. The UK AI market is valued at over $21 billion, with company growth of 145% over ten years. London, with over 760 AI enterprises, received significant investments, including £200 million in private and £500 million in public funding in 2017. The UK government invested £100 million in a supercomputer facility, reflecting substantial public investment in AI development.

merged_facts.merged_content: The UK has 334 AI startups, Germany has 167, and France has 135, ranking them first, second, and third in Europe, respectively.

related_facts.fact_group_content: Private capital investment in the UK was £3 billion in 2022.
Venture capital investment reached a record £12.3 billion in 2022.
It is estimated to add $1 trillion to the UK economy by 2035.
Amazon is investing EUR 10 billion into its German operations in June 2024.
Amazon's total investment in Germany is EUR 77 billion since 2010.
The British government has invested £100 million in a supercomputer facility in Bristol.
Germany received $7 billion in private investments between 2013 and 2022.

clusters.title: Capital Surge
clusters.description: In 2022, the UK saw significant investments with £3 billion in private capital and a record £12.3 billion in venture capital. The British government invested £100 million in a supercomputer facility in Bristol. Germany received $7 billion in private investments from 2013 to 2022. Amazon plans to invest EUR 10 billion in Germany in June 2024, adding to its total investment of EUR 77 billion since 2010. The UK economy is projected to gain $1 trillion by 2035 due to these investments.

related_facts.fact_group_content: AI research strongholds like the UK, Germany, Japan, India, Brazil, and Iran have each produced 10,000 to 140,000 papers.
Africa, South America, and most Asian nations contribute less than 5% collectively to AI research.
The EU27 published over 30,000 AI papers annually in the early period.
China's AI paper publications increased from around 13,000 in 2012 to nearly 60,000 in 2023.
India published over 17,000 AI papers in 2023, compared to under 4,000 a decade prior.

clusters.title: Research Publications
clusters.description: AI research has seen significant growth globally, with strong contributions from the UK, Germany, Japan, India, Brazil, and Iran, each producing 10,000 to 140,000 papers. The EU27 consistently published over 30,000 papers annually in early years. China's contributions surged from 13,000 publications in 2012 to nearly 60,000 in 2023. India also saw a significant increase, publishing over 17,000 papers in 2023 compared to under 4,000 a decade earlier. In contrast, Africa, South America, and most Asian nations collectively contribute less than 5% to AI research.

merged_facts.merged_content: AI research strongholds, including the UK, Germany, Japan, India, Brazil, and Iran, have each produced a significant number of AI papers from 2014-2023. The EU27 published over 30,000 AI papers annually in the early period. China's AI paper publications increased from around 13,000 in 2012 to nearly 60,000 in 2023. India published over 17,000 AI papers in 2023, compared to under 4,000 a decade prior.

article.title: Research on Artificial Intelligence – the global divides

merged_facts.narrative: Over the past decade, AI research has flourished globally. The UK, Germany, Japan, India, Brazil, and Iran have been key contributors, each generating a substantial number of AI papers from 2014 to 2023. Notably, the EU27 consistently published over 30,000 AI papers annually in the early years. China's AI output soared from approximately 13,000 papers in 2012 to nearly 60,000 by 2023, while India's publications surged from under 4,000 a decade ago to over 17,000 in 2023.

all_merged_facts_in_order.narrative: A recent study by AWS and Strand Partners reveals that 68% of German companies see potential turnover improvements with AI adoption. Interest in AI is growing, with 72% of Germans now believing it will dominate the next decade—a significant rise from 42% two years ago. Global sentiment echoes this, as 67% of worldwide respondents also view AI as the future, according to the Bosch Tech Compass survey.

merged_articles.title: Growing acceptance of artificial intelligence in Germany
From Not Now to No-Brainer: Germany's AI Transformation

all_merged_facts_in_order.merged_content: 34% of respondents in Germany believe AI will have a positive impact on society. This proportion has increased in recent years; in 2023, for instance, it was still at 26%. According to the Bosch Tech Compass survey conducted in fall 2024, 66% of respondents in China expect AI to have a positive impact.

all_merged_facts_in_order.merged_content: AI research strongholds, including the UK, Germany, Japan, India, Brazil, and Iran, have each produced a significant number of AI papers from 2014-2023. The EU27 published over 30,000 AI papers annually in the early period. China's AI paper publications increased from around 13,000 in 2012 to nearly 60,000 in 2023. India published over 17,000 AI papers in 2023, compared to under 4,000 a decade prior.

facts.fact_group_content: AI research strongholds like the UK, Germany, Japan, India, Brazil, and Iran have each produced 10,000 to 140,000 papers over the period 2014-2023.

article.title: Research on Artificial Intelligence – the global divides

all_merged_facts_in_order.narrative: Over the past decade, AI research has flourished globally. The UK, Germany, Japan, India, Brazil, and Iran have been key contributors, each generating a substantial number of AI papers from 2014 to 2023. Notably, the EU27 consistently published over 30,000 AI papers annually in the early years. China's AI output soared from approximately 13,000 papers in 2012 to nearly 60,000 by 2023, while India's publications surged from under 4,000 a decade ago to over 17,000 in 2023.
